title: Barrie Farmers Market - Saturdays
description: Welcome to one of Ontario’s oldest and most beloved farmers’ markets! Established in 1846 and still operating on its original site, the Barrie Farmers’ Market is a year-round destination for everything local. Each Saturday, visitors can explore a vibrant selection of fresh produce, handmade goods, baked treats, and ready-to-enjoy meals, all proudly crafted by growers, makers, and artisans from Barrie and the surrounding region. It’s a true farmers’ market—where every vendor is passionate about their craft and happy to share their stories. Enjoy live music, family-friendly activities, and the warm, welcoming atmosphere that has made this market a community staple for generations. Whether you're shopping for weekly groceries, grabbing a snack, or simply soaking up the local charm, the Barrie Farmers’ Market is the place to be every Saturday morning. Come experience tradition, community, and local flavour—all in the heart of downtown Barrie.

title: Chappell Farms Fall Festival
description: Where New Family Traditions are made, and Old Traditions are celebrated each year! September 20 – October 31 Open daily 9:00 am – 6:00 pm. Attractions include Farm Animals, Sunflower Maze, Kids Maze, Tricycle Track, Sand Diggers, Magic Show (weekends only), Wagon Rides to the Pumpkin Patch, and more. Book Your School Group Tour, Corporate Team Building Day, or Customer Appreciation Day.
price: $12.00 per person + tax (Weekdays), $15.00 per person + tax (Weekends & Holidays)

title: Pumpkin Mania (Weekends)
description:
Pumpkin Mania runs Saturdays, Sundays, and Holiday Monday, with Fridays open for Fall Fun. Soak up the fresh country air and enjoy a full day at Ranchland with over 25 activities included in admission, plus a Pick-Your-Own (PYO) free pumpkin, any size, any colour.

Families can explore the Petting Zoo, Corn Maze, Tractor Rides, the Buckaroo Bouncer, and many more attractions that will keep everyone entertained for hours. Ranchland’s 25+ self-guided and staff-led activities are all included with admission, along with the PYO pumpkin experience.

Pumpkin Mania Games take place every half hour and feature Pumpkin Tosses, Slam Dunk Pumpkin challenges, Pumpkin Bowling, Seed Spitting, and the always-popular Pumpkin Pie Eating Contests. Winners earn a Pumpkin Prize Token, redeemable at the Pumpkin Hut for treats like candy, popcorn, and fun prizes. Guests can also watch for Peek-A-Boo Pumpkins hidden around the ranch—find one and win a special prize at the Pumpkin Hut. From Pumpkin Sack Races to Pumpkin Hockey, there is fun around every corner.

Visitors can add a little extra to their day with Animal Feed ($5/bag), Pony Rides ($10/ride), Corn Cannon shots ($5 for 8), additional pumpkins (one is included per admission), the Cookhouse (open daily), and the Mercantile Gift Shop (open daily).

Come make unforgettable fall-time memories at Rounds Ranch, a family-run farm filled with outdoor adventure and seasonal fun.

title: Pumpkinferno at Discovery Harbour
description: Pumpkinferno sails into Discovery Harbour for a hauntingly good time! Experience the phenomenon of Pumpkinferno’s NEW magical outdoor exhibits of artificial hand-carved pumpkins! Plus discover roving performers, tour the Macabre Mansion, pick up some glowing cotton candy, and much more! Discovery Harbour is transformed with more than 5,000 artificial “fun-kins”, lights, music and activities! Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday bring the whole family and experience the walk-thru Pumpkinferno magic. Roving buskers will delight and entertain visitors with fire, magic and more! The Bubbling Cauldron Café will be open with glowing cotton candy, fresh made popcorn, hot chocolate, spooky snacks and more! The Swamp Snack Shack will be open with drinks and snacks. Food Truck options will be available such as Beaver tails. Check website for full details and schedule: discoveryharbour.on.ca/events/pumpkinferno Add extra fun to your Pumpkinferno evening with these experiences: Bosun’s Brig: Escape Room – Bring your team of 3-6 players and escape our historic prison! Advance ticket purchase is required, as space is limited. $24 per person (includes tax). Secrets of Séance – Step into the mysterious world of Victorian spiritualism with Secrets of Séance, an immersive new experience at Discovery Harbour. $24 per person (includes tax). Coffin Ride – An immersive experience like no other! This is a one-person experience and is $5 per person (includes tax). Wristrained! – Five minute, mini-escape room. Five go in…will all escape…intact? This is a five-person, five-minute experience and is $5 per person (includes tax).
price: Admission to Pumpkinferno is additional and required

title: Drysdale's Haunted Harvest Village (Weekends Only)
description: The Halloween spirit howls at Drysdale's Haunted Harvest Village running each weekend until Halloween. Be it their first Halloween or recapturing memories of the past, Drysdale's Haunted Harvest Village provides everything for a memorable October outing. Search for the great pumpkin and The Evergreen Store will fulfill your needs for decorating your home inside and out. Enjoy a day of frightful fun, pumpkin picking and Halloween gift and décor shopping. Activities Include: Haunted Wagon Ride, Pick Pocket Magician, Obstacle Course, Pumpkin Picking, Bonfire & Marshmallow Roasting, Train Rides, Children's Zip Line, and more.

title: Quayle's Fall Festival
description: Celebrate the harvest season at Quayle’s Brewery! From October 9 to 31, enjoy fresh hop beers, a seasonal fall menu, and live local music every weekend. Festival Highlights: Comedy Night (ticketed), Hoptoberfest with games for all ages, Family-friendly activities, Wagon rides and pumpkin painting, Halloween Bash to close out the festival. Experience the beauty of the farm, the flavours of the harvest, and the warmth of the season at Quayle’s Fall Festival.

title: Hallowalk at Friday Harbour
description: Friday Harbour brings you the best of the spooky season. Enjoy an evening of thrills and chills as the Nature Preserve transforms into a haunted Halloween trail. Travel through the woods along a lit path with spooky décor and themed zones. Ghosts, pumpkins, witches, and more come to life in the Nature Preserve as guests follow the trail starting at Friday Drive and Hickory Lane.

title: 28th Barrie Film Festival
description: The 28th edition of this multifaceted festival provides a curated selection of films from all over the world with a particular emphasis on Canadian creators and their work.

title: Hardwood Ski and Bike Ski Swap
description: The Saturday (October 18th) morning entry to Swap must be reserved in advance by online registration. Those not on our list will not be admitted on Saturday (October 18th) at 9am or 10:45am. Saturday shopping times will run in blocks of 90 minutes starting at 9am, with a 15-minute break between blocks. Shoppers may only enter the swap within their allotted time block; shoppers do not need to arrive exactly at the start of their block. In an effort to ensure blocks are filled fairly, a $10 per person fee will be charged at registration. This fee can be recuperated as Ski Swap credit for purchases of at least $10 before tax (Fees may only be recuperated individually). Fee will not be refunded for no-shows, cancellations, or those who leave the Ski without a purchase from the Swap or Retail Store. Starting Saturday, October 18th at 12:15pm, through to Thursday, October 23rd the Swap is open to all visitors with no reservation required. No fee will be charged, and no discount will be applied to purchases.

title: Speaking of Wildlife
description: Join us for PA Day fun and educational live-animal presentations at the Five Points Theatre on October 24th with Speaking of Wildlife and their animal ambassadors. There are three sessions available: 10:30am: arrival, static displays and crafts 11am: A 30-minute Interactive Presentation will feature native Ontario wildlife ambassadors and information about their species, adaptations, and habitat. 12:30pm: arrival, static displays and crafts 1pm: A 30-minute Interactive Presentation will feature native Ontario wildlife ambassadors and information about their species, adaptations, and habitat. 2:30pm: arrival, static display and crafts 3pm: A 30-minute Interactive Presentation will feature native Ontario wildlife ambassadors and information about their species, adaptations, and habitat. Guests will have the opportunity to meet and greet with incredible wildlife friends like opossums, hawks, turtles, owls and more!
address_line_1: The Five Points Theatre, 1 Dunlop Street West

title: Blue Rodeo: "Lost Together" - The 40th Anniversary Tour
description: Today, legendary alt-country rockers Blue Rodeo announced they'll be hitting the road for a brand-new Canadian tour, celebrating an incredible 40 years of music. Spanning cities from coast to coast, this milestone tour honours one of Canada's most beloved and enduring bands. From their roots in the Toronto club scene to becoming national icons, Blue Rodeo has spent four decades creating the soundtrack to countless Canadian lives — and they're not done yet. Joining them on all dates is acclaimed singer/songwriter Adam Baldwin, bringing his powerful live energy and East Coast spirit to the stage. Don't miss this unforgettable celebration of four decades of songs, stories, and the road in between.

title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show (Movie Screening)
description: Let's Do the Time Warp... Again! Join us for the 50th Anniversary Celebration of The Rocky Horror Picture Show — the ultimate cult classic that broke all the rules and created a phenomenon! Slip into your fishnets, grab your toast, and get ready for a wild night of audience participation, iconic music, and absolute pleasure. Whether you're a die-hard Transylvanian or a curious first-timer, this golden anniversary promises to be louder, weirder, and more fabulous than ever. **Doors open at 7pm and the movie starts at 8pm** The full Rocky experience - patrons are free to yell, talk and dance along. You are encouraged to dress up, dance and sing along. Props are welcome (kits will be available for purchase, pending availability) - here is what you can bring: Bubbles (NO rice please!) for the wedding scene Newspapers to hold over your head when Brad and Janet are in the storm Toast/Melba toast (unbuttered) for when Frankie calls a toast at dinner Party horns for the end of the creation speech Rubber gloves for the creation speech (great sound effect if snapped in sync) Please be respectful of other patrons - NOTE this is an immersive film screening. Do not throw items at the screen or other patrons. Rated: R (Strictly 19+) Themed décor, delicious cocktails and mocktails, popcorn & concessions available for purchase before the film and during intermission in the lower lobby.
address_line_1: Five Points Theatre, 1 Dunlop Street West

title: Haunted Happenings in Miramichi
description: Ghosts, zombies, legendary haunts, scary trails, corn mazes, parks and graveyards are waiting for you in Miramichi! Come to our many spooktacular events for the entire family and discover the mysterious side of Miramichi…if you dare! Events are planned in various locations, including Wilson’s Point Cemetery, French Fort Cove, Queen Elizabeth Park as well as in Upper Blackville and Williamstown.

title: New Maryland Halloween House
description: Family of 3 running a walk through display located in the Springwater Subdivision of New Maryland, near Fredericton, during the Halloween season. Thursday/Friday/Saturday nights from 6:30pm to 8:30pm (weather permitting). $5 per group of up to 5 people (includes 1 free raffle ticket for prizes donated by local vendors). More raffle tickets are $5 each. Special charity nights held Friday & Saturday October 24-25 from 6pm to 9pm in support of Mothers Against Drunk Driving.
price: $5 per group of up to 5 people

title: Rockwood Park Haunted Campground
description: Join us for a spine-chilling experience at Rockwood Park Haunted Campground during the second half of October. Pick the Low Scare or Heart-pounding Scare option and prepare yourself for a night filled with eerie encounters, terrifying trails, and bone-chilling surprises.
address_line_1: Rockwood Park Campground 142 Lake Drive South

title: Parlures d'icitte Storytelling Festival
description: Parlures d'icitte is the only Francophone storytelling festival in the Maritimes. Every year it brings together national and even international storytellers who take young and old on a journey in a variety of activities! Shows, storytelling meals, treasure hunts, mystery evenings and many more.

title: Boo at the Zoo
description: A spooktacular family tradition at the Magnetic Hill Zoo! Step into our 40-acre park transformed with Halloween magic. From silly and spooky decorations to hair-raising haunted venues, there’s something for everyone—whether you’re a little pumpkin 🎃 or a full-on thrill seeker. So get your tickets and don’t miss your chance to experience the wildest thrills in town!

title: Folk Racines Festival
description: Folk Racines Festival celebrates farming, rural Acadie and harvest time in Rogersville. There is something for everyone: cultural and artistic activities, activities for children, rural university, workshops, tastings, open day at the farm and great food!

title: FearFest in Grand Falls
description: Celebrate Halloween in Grand Falls with a magical stroll along the Pumpkin Trail, where more than 400 artistically decorated pumpkins, live characters, music, and food trucks create a festive fall wonderland. Then, test your courage in the Haunted House, a thrilling maze of spooky surprises and eerie encounters, complete with a photo booth and canteen treats—perfect Halloween fun for all ages!

title: Semaine Music·Musique NB Week
description: Taking place in Moncton, New Brunswick, the Semaine Music·Musique NB Week is three days of showcases, conferences and awards. Discover (or re-discover) amazing emerging and established New Brunswick musical talents.

title: Dia de los Muertos Saint John
description: Enjoy ballet performances, art installations, live music, and much more. Don't miss out on this unique celebration of culture and Mexican heritage! Dia de los Muertos is a traditional Mexican festival that celebrates art, culture, and community while honouring those that have come before us. The event is a welcoming experience that is built on diversity and inclusion, and adds a new layer to Saint John’s urban vibrancy.

title: Choral Fest
description: Every year, singers from New Brunswick and around the country gather at the New Brunswick Choral Federation’s Choral Fest to rehearse and perform a significant work under one of Canada’s leading choral conductors. Choral Fest 2025 will feature “A Season to Sing,” a choral reimagining by British composer Joanna Forbes l’Estrange of Vivaldi‘s beloved and timeless The Four Seasons. Come Sing With Us!
address_line_1: Saint Paul’s United Church 4 Morrison Avenue

title: FrancoFête en Acadie
description: The FrancoFête en Acadie is an annual Acadian and Francophone performing arts event bringing together presenters, artists and professionals in the sector as well as the public. During this event produced by RADARTS, an organization promoting francophone performing arts throughout the Atlantic provinces, everyone is invited to enjoy a selection of quality showcases and shows.

title: Haunted Trails at Daly Point Nature Reserve
description: Enjoy Halloween activities at Daly Point Nature Reserve in Bathurst! Families are invited to walk the trails in costume and receive Halloween treats. Join us after dark to get frighten in the trails at Daly Point! Dressed up volunteers there to scare you throughout the trails. Come alone or in a group and sign in before accessing the trails.

title: Silver Wave Film Festival
description: Over 100 films by local, national, and international filmmakers; workshops, panels, parties, and guest filmmakers. Every year’s event offers a showcase of multicultural, international, French and English programming of all genres and lengths and a comprehensive industry series which brings experienced, emerging producers and filmmakers together.

title: The Wrapped Garden (Le Jardin emballé)
description: The New Brunswick Botanical Garden displays a sparkling and illuminated decor that will enchant the young and young at heart during the Wrapped Garden (Jardin emballé) event kicking off the magic of the holiday season. At the heart of this event is a large public market bringing together more than fifty vendors showcasing local products, impressive artwork, and unique crafts. Musicians and singers are on site to delight everyone's ears and hearts, and culinary treats will delight foodies and make your mouth water.

title: Moncton Wine Expo
description: Experience the ultimate fusion of exceptional wines and gourmet cuisine at Moncton’s Wine Expo. Attend a grand tasting of wines from local and international vineyards with gourmet bites from the region’s finest Chefs and food purveyors, and a series of wine tastings and seminars tailored to suit all tastes and budgets.

title: Christmas at the Station
description: The McAdam Railway Station invites you to join us for Christmas at the Station for two weeks in November. See this historic heritage railway station all decorated and lit beautifully for Christmas – it is a magical experience for the entire family. Every visitor is greeted with a hot cup of cider and each room is decorated by non-profit organizations, residents of McAdam, and local businesses.

title: Monde en fête Intercultural Festival
description: Monde en fête is an intercultural festival organized by CAFi (Centre d’accueil et d’accompagnement francophone des immigrants du Sud-Est du Nouveau-Brunswick), a non-profit organization that helps francophone immigrants to become settled in the community. This event aims to bring together people from various backgrounds to celebrate diversity through performances, exhibitions, food, and cultural activities.
hosts: ["CAFi (Centre d\u2019accueil et d\u2019accompagnement francophone des immigrants du Sud-Est du Nouveau-Brunswick)"]

title: Saint John Beer Fest
description: Get ready for an unforgettable time at the Saint John Beer Fest! Join us at the Saint John Trade & Convention Centre for a high-energy celebration of craft beer, cider, seltzers, and ready-to-drink creations from near and far. Enjoy bottomless samples, carnival-style games, live entertainment, and unbeatable vibes — all in support of Housing Alternatives, providing safe and affordable housing for youth in need.
address_line_1: Saint John Trade and Convention Centre, 1 Market Square

title: FICFA (Festival international du cinéma francophone en Acadie)
description: The Festival international du cinéma francophone en Acadie (FICFA) showcases filmmakers from around the globe and highlights local talents in the Acadian and French film industry. Since 1987, this film festival presents a variety of films across different genres, including documentaries, comedies, dramas, and short films, many with English sub-titles so Francophiles can enjoy a wide selection of films. Whether you’re a film enthusiast or curious about Acadian and French culture, FICFA offers a meaningful and enriching experience in the heart of Moncton!

title: Rothesay Yule Christmas Market
description: Brought to you by The Maritime Edit and together with CAA Atlantic, the Rothesay Yule is the kick-off to the season and a must attend fundraising event. Hosted both indoors and outdoors, indulge in a cosy marketplace of shopping and soak up the festive spirit; complete with live festive music, magic shows, petting zoo, complimentary treats and, of course, a special visit and family photo with Santa.

title: Christmas at the King's Head Inn in Kings Landing
description: Since 1983, innkeepers at the King’s Head Inn have guided tens of thousands of guests by candlelight through the snow and into the magical warmth of the Inn. Join in this tradition and get in the spirit of Christmas! Once you enter the Inn, you will be met with a burst of Christmas music to get you in the spirit before the call to dine. After your meal, enjoy treats of Port, walnut toffee and gingerbread cookies. Book online and make this tradition your own!

title: New Brunswick Spirits Festival
description: Canada's oldest spirits festival! Join us for a multi-day celebration of the world’s finest spirits, featuring top-tier brands and industry experts from around the globe. Events include various dinners host by brand ambassadors and world renowned food experts, a huge selection of master classes, a special event at the Beaverbrook Art Gallery, the famous Festival Showcase and more! Onsite store operated by ANBL with festival exclusive products available for purchase.

title: Turner’s Christmas at the Coliseum
description: The Turner's Christmas Exhibition, every year in November, features gift ideas for everyone on your Christmas list. With hundreds of exhibitors to choose from, you will find arts, crafts, wood working, jewelry, gourmet food and much more. You are sure to find that special gift for that special someone!

title: Greater Moncton Santa Claus Parade
description: Bright lights, colourful costumes, festive music and a whole lot of good cheer, that’s what the ROYALE® Greater Moncton Santa Claus Parade is all about. Nothing warms the heart on a cold winter’s night like being surrounded by thousands of friendly faces and taking part in an age-old tradition, so fill your thermoses, head down to Main Street, huddle up with your loved ones and get ready to welcome the “Big Guy” to town.

title: Christmas by-the-Sea in Saint Andrews
description: Come to Saint Andrews by-the-Sea and celebrate everything Christmas with us! Experience the magic of our lovely town during the Holidays.
